mainEntity.name: What is hair Erbium laser and how does it work?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hair Erbium laser is a medical treatment that generates controlled microchannels in the scalp, allowing better absorption of actives such as vitamins, growth factors or drugs, and stimulating the hair follicle to improve hair quality.

mainEntity.name: Is the hair Erbium treatment painful?

acceptedAnswer.text: It is a minimally invasive procedure that is usually well tolerated. It may generate a slight sensation of heat or small discomfort during application, but does not require anesthesia or prolonged recovery times.

mainEntity.name: How many hair Erbium sessions do I need?

acceptedAnswer.text: Usually between 4 and 6 sessions, spaced every 3 to 4 weeks. The amount is adjusted according to medical diagnosis and the evolution of each patient.

mainEntity.name: What results can I expect from hair Erbium laser?

acceptedAnswer.text: The treatment helps reduce hair loss, improve hair density and thickness, and provide greater vitality and shine. Results are progressive and optimized when combined with mesotherapy or PRP.

mainEntity.name: For what type of hair loss is hair Erbium indicated?

acceptedAnswer.text: Erbium laser is useful in cases of diffuse hair loss, telogen effluvium due to stress or postpartum, and hair thinning. In advanced androgenetic alopecia it is used as part of a comprehensive treatment plan.

mainEntity.name: Can hair Erbium be combined with other treatments?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, it is common to combine it with mesotherapy, platelet-rich plasma (PRP), and topical drugs like minoxidil to enhance results.

mainEntity.name: Is there recovery time after the treatment?

acceptedAnswer.text: No recovery time is required. The patient can return to their usual activities immediately, although a slight temporary redness may be observed in the treated area.

mainEntity.name: How long does a hair Erbium session last?

acceptedAnswer.text: Each session usually lasts between 30 and 45 minutes, depending on the extent of the area to be treated and the products applied in combination.

mainEntity.name: Is hair Erbium a safe treatment?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, it is a safe treatment when performed by a specialized doctor with appropriate equipment. A medical protocol is followed that minimizes risks and ensures an effective procedure.

mainEntity.name: Is hair Erbium laser only for men?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, the treatment is indicated for both men and women, adapting the protocol to the causes of hair loss and the individual characteristics of each patient.
